title: Mr. Robot season 4: What will Olivia mean for Elliot’s mission to destroy Whiterose?
text:
We’ve got thoughts about the next episode of Mr. Robot (Picture: Amazon Prime)

Mr. Robot’s Elliot Alderson is terrible boyfriend material. He’s flaky, he’s rubbish at returning calls and he spends way too much time staring at his computer screen. Worst of all – and this is definitely something he shouldn’t put on his Tinder profile – everyone he has a romantic entanglement with winds up dead. Unpleasantly dead.

Shayla, Elliot’s neighbour-turned-girlfriend from season one met a heart-breaking and brutal end at the hands of crazed drug dealer Vera. And then his oldest friend Angela – who he shared a passionate kiss with in season three, potentially sparking the start of a much-anticipated relationship – was dispatched by the Dark Army at the start of this final chapter.

So, where does this leave Olivia Cortez (Dominik Garcia-Lorido), the single mum Elliot seduced in order to steal a security code that would give him access to Whiterose’s Cyprus National Bank account?

Advertisement

At first it seemed ice-cold Elliot would stay totally focused on his mission – to get the code and get out – but Olivia’s moving bathroom confessional about her struggles with drugs and suicidal thoughts helped to create a connection with the lonely hacker and, boom, the pair suddenly went all gooey eyed on each other.

Olivia’s final comment that she’d told Elliot enough about herself “for tonight”, suggests this could be the beginning of something serious. But is her arrival on the scene a game-changer for Elliot? And where does it leave his urgent mission to destroy Whiterose?

Here’s what could happen next…

Olivia inspires him

Can we trust Olivia? (Picture: Amazon Prime)

As Elliot knows, the clock is ticking. If he doesn’t bring down Whiterose he’s a dead man – and dead men make even worse boyfriends than flaky, call-screening, computer obsessives. Before meeting Olivia, his prime reason for defeating Whiterose was to save Darlene’s life, but now he has the tiniest glimpse of a potentially happy future for himself, will that hope help inspire him when the going inevitably gets tough? Does the show’s creator Sam Esmail, who’s described this final season as ‘sentimental’, have a happy ending up his sleeve for Elliot?

He’s thrown off course

Advertisement

Advertisement

We all know what happens to people when they first start a new relationship – they disappear. Trapped in a love bubble, they get distracted and everything else gets left by the wayside. Elliot knows he’s in a dramatic race against time to stop Whiterose, so it’s unlikely he’d lose sight of his objective – and Mr Robot and Darlene would surely never allow that. But in such an epic battle against such a powerful enemy, the smallest lack of focus could spell disaster.

She’s an agent for Whiterose

If there’s one thing Whiterose understands, it’s the benefit of knowing someone’s weak spot. She easily manipulated Angela with the promise of somehow resurrecting her dead mother; she’s long exploited Phillip Price’s thirst for power and riches; and she’s keeping poor Dom in line with good, old-fashioned threats towards her family.

Olivia’s past problems with addiction and the loss of one of her parents makes her a near mirror-image of Elliot. They also make her a near-perfect combination of both Shayla and Angela. It all sounds too good to be true, doesn’t it? So, perhaps it is. Perhaps Olivia, to use hacker terminology, is a honeypot placed in Elliot’s way by the all-seeing Whiterose, to distract him from his mission – or to take him down.

It all ends in tragedy

Will there be a happy ending? Unlikely (Picture: Amazon Prime)

As mentioned, Elliot’s love interests have a habit of coming to a sticky end. And with the equally menacing Whiterose and Vera circling around Elliot right now, Olivia would be putting her life in great danger by taking things further with him.

Advertisement

We’re not sure we could handle another tragic death of someone close to Elliot, so hopefully he’ll do the sensible thing and channel that natural flakiness and ghost Olivia until it all blows over.

Mr. Robot continues tonight on the USA Network and will follow a day later on Amazon Prime UK.
